info.title: Contacts
info.x-hubspot-api-use-case: Retrieve a contact by ID to bring that contact data into your external system.
info.x-hubspot-introduction: Use the contacts API to create and manage contacts.

post.description: Retrieve a batch of contacts by ID (`contactId`) or unique property value (`idProperty`).

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

get.description: Retrieve a contact by its ID (`contactId`) or by a unique property (`idProperty`). You can specify what is returned using the `properties` query parameter.

parameters.name: contactId
parameters.description: The ID of the contact to retrieve.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored.

parameters.name: propertiesWithHistory
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned along with their history of previous values. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored.

parameters.name: associations
parameters.description: A comma separated list of object types to retrieve associated IDs for. If any of the specified associations do not exist, they will be ignored.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

delete.description: Delete a contact by ID. Deleted contacts can be restored within 90 days of deletion. Learn more about the [data impacted by contact deletions](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/privacy-and-consent/understand-restorable-and-permanent-contact-deletions) and how to [restore archived records](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/records/restore-deleted-records).

parameters.name: contactId
parameters.description: The ID of the contact to delete.

patch.description: Update a contact by ID (`contactId`) or unique property value (`idProperty`). Provided property values will be overwritten. Read-only and non-existent properties will result in an error. Properties values can be cleared by passing an empty string.

parameters.name: contactId
parameters.description: The ID of the contact to update.

post.description: Merge two contact records. Learn more about [merging records](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/records/merge-records).

Archive a batch of contacts by ID. Archived contacts can be restored within 90 days of deletion. Learn more about the [data impacted by contact deletions](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/privacy-and-consent/understand-restorable-and-permanent-contact-deletions) and how to [restore archived records](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/records/restore-deleted-records).

Create a batch of contacts. The `inputs` array can contain a `properties` object to define property values for each record, along with an `associations` array to define [associations](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/associations/associations-v4) with other CRM records.

Update a batch of contacts by ID (`contactId`) or unique property value (`idProperty`). Provided property values will be overwritten. Read-only and non-existent properties will result in an error. Properties values can be cleared by passing an empty string.

Permanently delete a contact and all associated content to follow GDPR. Use optional property `idProperty` set to `email` to identify contact by email address. If email address is not found, the email address will be added to a blocklist and prevent it from being used in the future. Learn more about [permanently deleting contacts](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/privacy-and-consent/how-do-i-perform-a-gdpr-delete-in-hubspot).

get.description: Retrieve all contacts, using query parameters to specify the information that gets returned.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored.

parameters.name: propertiesWithHistory
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned along with their history of previous values. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored. Usage of this parameter will reduce the maximum number of objects that can be read by a single request.

parameters.name: associations
parameters.description: A comma separated list of object types to retrieve associated IDs for. If any of the specified associations do not exist, they will be ignored.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

post.description: Create a single contact. Include a `properties` object to define [property values](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/properties) for the contact, along with an `associations` array to define [associations](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/associations/associations-v4) with other CRM records.

post.summary: Create or update a batch of contacts
post.description: Create a batch of contacts. The `inputs` array can contain a `properties` object to define property values for each record, along with an `associations` array to define [associations](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/associations/associations-v4) with other CRM records.

Search for contacts by filtering on properties, searching through associations, and sorting results. Learn more about [CRM search](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/search#make-a-search-request).

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate
message.example: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

idProperty.description: The name of a property whose values are unique for this object
The name of a property whose values are unique for this object. An alternative to identifying a contact by ID.

objectId.description: The ID of the contact to permanently delete.

idProperty.description: The name of a unique property, when identifying records by property.

id.description: The ID of the contact to update. This can be the object ID, or the unique property value of the `idProperty` property.
